title: Radar Roundup: Standert Erdgeschoss Stainless, Slow Ly Bags from Ukraine, Lauf Cycles Opens Assembly Plant in USA, Sim Works Extra Rice & Beans, Appleman 2XR Rental Fitting Cranks, Handup Women’s Hot Lap Short, and Monte: Can’t stop. Won’t stop.
content:
Our Radar Roundup compiles products and videos from the ‘net in an easy-to-digest format. Read on below for today’s findings…

Standert Erdgeschoss Stainless Returns

Versatility is the name of the game when it comes to the 2023 model of Standert’s Erdgeschoss stainless steel gravel bike. Sporting clearance for 700 x 50mm or 650b x 54mm tires, sliding dropouts for extra clearance or singlespeed options, a flip chip in the fork, dynamo routing, and mounts a plenty for various cargo applications.

What caught our eye were the flashy new paintjobs, sporting names like Ka-Pow! Khaki and Yeah! Yellow.

Roll on over to Standert to scope the all-new 2023 Erdgeschoss Stainless.

Slow Ly Upcycled Bags from Ukraine $60

Slow Ly are small local Ukrainian upcycle brand that focuses on re-use and recycling. Its idea is to create bags and accessories from non-standard materials (leftovers from various technological productions – paragliders, small ships, parachutes, sails). Resulting in products that have an eco-initiative, aiming to show that each thing has a much longer life path than it seems at first glance and in turn, is developing the direction of sustainable fashion in Ukraine.

Slow Ly’s Zgar Bag is a small messenger style/hip bag that would make for a great gravel or mtb accessory bag to carry ride necessities.

Specs:

  • Upper access point to the main compartment with a roll-top clasp
  • Breathable design of the back panel from foam and mesh material provides convenient landing and a high level of comfort
  • Inner zippered pockets
  • Pocket for valuables on the back
  • Pack adjusts volume by cinch straps
  • Lateral compression slings for stabilization
  • Comfortable belt
  • Made in Ukraine

See more at Slow Ly.

Lauf Cycles Opens Assembly Plant in USA

Lauf Cycling’s suspension innovation needs no introduction. The brand has gone from a small, garage-based design and development company to an international name when it comes to their unique forks and frames. To further streamline its operations, Lauf has been busy setting up a USA base in Harrisonburg, VA. Why Harrisonburg, you might ask? Because it offers amazing riding (gravel, road and MTB), and because it’s a beautiful college town with excellent ground logistics for the US and flight connections to Iceland.

Earlier this year Lauf started shipping US-bound bikes from its Harrisonburg warehouse. This increased the brand’s efficiency and enabled a substantial price reduction on March 11th.
.
The new pricing break applies to both the Seigla rigid and the Seigla with suspension fork and all models of the Weekend Warriot with percentage drops ranging from 12% to 17.9%.

See the new pricing at Lauf Cycling.

Sim Works Extra Rice & Beans Bag $120

Compatible with Sim Works’ new Burrito Rack, the Extra Rice & Beans Bag is a roll-top bag available in a range of colorways and material specs. The Extra Rice & Beans uses premium hardware by German outfit Fidlock for the magnetic closure at the roll-top and the cinch-lock for quick access. A reinforced padded base and lower ‘walls’ will protect your cargo during mixed-terrain rides on your local double-track. A purpose-built webbing attachment system with cord-lock toggles will secure the bag to Burrito rack’s corner anchor points. Dual daisy chains would allow this bag to be secured to another rack. A reflective chevron sewn to the back of the bag adds a subtle touch of safety.

See more at Sim Works.

Appleman 2XR Rental Fitting Cranks

Curious about what crank length you should ride? Or are you a bike fit specialist looking to dial in the perfect fit for a specific client? Well, Appleman wants you to be riding the best crank length for you. Sometimes you gotta’ try it before you buy it.The 2XR FIT Crankset Rental program lets you try different length cranks on your own bike, from the comfort of your own saddle on your own time.

So how does the rental work? You pay full-price deposit for the FIT cranks and other parts up front. Upon returning the Fitting Cranks back to Appleman, we refund you the full amount minus the rental costs. You’ll have up to 3 weeks from delivery day to install and test the cranks. Cranks and parts need to be shipped in this 3 week window using the provided shipping label.

If you want to purchase your own 2XR Crankset, this is the time to do it! Fill out the included order form with the rental cranks with what you want and you’ll receive a $50 credit towards the new cranks. After we receive the cranks, we’ll check to see if you wanted to order a crankset and then refund the remaining balance after taking out rental costs.

Check out more at Appleman.

Hand Up Women’s Hot Lap Short $69

The Hot Lap Short is the go-to short for all of your activities! Hand Up took its existing A.T. + Shorts and fashioned them to fit female riders in all the best ways.

This short is for adventures that put a beating on your gear and they’ll keep coming back for more after a quick wash. Of course, they are casual enough to wear to a margarita happy hour, as well! Snag a pair and try them for casual Friday’s at work, days in the woods hiking or biking, or going out on the town!

Specs:

  • Quick Drying Four-Way Stretch Fabric that moves with you: 90% Nylon 10% Spandex
  • Abrasion Resistant
  • Hidden Back Pockets with usable depth
  • Durable and Shows Little Wear
  • Hidden YKK zipper front pockets so you don’t lose any valuables
  • Reinforced Nylon Strap holding the button onto the front for extra durability
  • Belt loops for added functionality
  • Minimal logos on back bottom of the left leg and top of right rear pocket
  • 7″ Inseam to ensure no seat chafing

Check out more at Hand Up.
